thread.title: Why This De Beers Lab Makes Diamonds It Will Never Sell
thread.title_full: Why This De Beers Lab Makes Diamonds It Will Never Sell

author: From bloomberg.com
title: Why This De Beers Lab Makes Diamonds It Will Never Sell
text: From bloomberg.com Scientists at De Beers can make near-flawless diamonds in a lab, but they will never sell you one. The 127-year-old mining companys Element Six unit, named for the carbon atoms rank on the periodic table, makes gems that are as perfect as any found at Tiffany & Co. stores, yet their destination is a 1980s office complex on the edge of London. There, a team of 62 studies their creations and develops machines for diamond buyers trying to spot synthetic stones being peddled as the real thing. While still a small part of the market, man-made diamonds are now being mass produced, and retailers like Wal-Mart Stores Inc. sell them to ... (
